sense.def:
Kadar je nekaj
thick
, je med nasprotnima površinama tistega precejšnja razdalja.

seg.quote: We were separated by thick concrete walls.
Last winter the snow lay thick on the ground.
She buttered my bread thickly.

sense.def:
Nekaj, kar je iz več stvari, je
thick
, kadar je teh stvari v tistem veliko.

seg.quote: She had a lot of thick black hair.
They were on the edge of the thick forest.
She came out of the thickest part of the crowd.
Plants and trees grew thickly on both sides of the river.

sense.def:
Izraz
thick
pove, kako široko ali globoko je nekaj.

seg.quote: The tree was one foot thick at the base.
Insert a new wire of the same thickness and wind it round the screws.

sense.def:
V tekočinah, ki so
thick
, je zelo malo vode in ne tečejo lahko.

seg.quote: The chef has made the sauce too thick.
...thick cream.

sense.def:
Kadar je dim ali megla
thick
, se skoznjo slabo vidi.

seg.quote: The fog seemed to be getting thicker.

sense.def:
Kadar je glas nekoga
thick
, ne govori razločno, na primer zato, ker je bolan, razburjen ali pijan.

seg.quote: His voice sounded blurred and thick.
‘Let's get out of here,’ Tom said thickly.
They were too thick to notice it.

sense.def:
Kadar se stvari dogajajo
thick and fast
, se dogajajo zelo hitro in v velikem številu.

seg.quote: More discoveries followed thick and fast.

sense.def:
To be thick with something
pomeni biti poln nečesa ali prekrit s tistim.

seg.quote: The air was thick with butterflies.
The windows were thick with grime.

sense.def:
Kadar je nekdo
in the thick of an activity or situation
, je zelo poglobljen ali vpleten v neko dejavnost ali dogajanje.

seg.quote: It won't be long before Amanda is in the thick of O levels.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj delamo
through thick and thin
, tisto delamo kljub temu, da so razmere ali okoliščine zelo slabe.

seg.quote: She stayed with her husband through thick and thin.
